text: Samanabedda cave temple (Sinhalaː සමනබැද්ද පුරාණ ගල්ලෙන් විහාරය) is an ancient Buddhist temple situated in Uhana, Ampara District, Sri Lanka. The temple lies on the Ampara – Mahaoya main road, approximately away from the town of Ampara. The temple has been formally recognised by the Government as an archaeological site in Sri Lanka. It is believed that the temple was built by king Saddha Tissa (137-119 BC). ==Gallery== File:Samanabedda cave temple 2.jpg|The ruined Stupa File:Samanabedda cave temple 3.jpg|Rubble of ruined buildings ==References== Category:Buddhist temples in Ampara District Category:Buddhist caves in Sri Lanka Category:Archaeological protected monuments in Ampara District
title: Samanabedda cave temple
